news.title: Father of two stabbed to death in spiralling Dublin feud had no involvement in violence
news.summary: A football club captain who was stabbed to death as part of a spiralling Dublin dispute had no involvement in the feud violence.

news.title: Runners and riders in Ireland’s race for the presidency – and where the potential candidates stand right now
news.summary: Sinn Féin leader Mary Lou McDonald has opened the door to contesting the presidential election in a move that could recast what had been billed as a lacklustre campaign.

news.title: Gaza ceasefire can be reached but may take more time, Israeli officials say
news.summary: Gaps in Gaza ceasefire talks under way in Qatar between Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas can be bridged but it may take more than a few days to reach a deal, Israeli officials said on Tuesday.

news.title: New anti-fraud system is labelling hospital texts and other legitimate messages as ‘likely scam’
news.summary: Ireland’s new crackdown on scam texts is labelling real texts as fraudulent – leading to confusion over hospital appointments, digital verification codes and sports tickets.

news.title: Dublin’s 1974 All-Ireland-winning football captain Seán Doherty has died at the age of 78
news.summary: Dublin's 1974 All-Ireland-winning football captain Seán Doherty has sadly passed away after a short illness at the age of 78.

news.title: ‘The right of way to our house is becoming unusable and the owner is ignoring us. Can we do the maintenance on the laneway ourselves?’
news.summary: Query: Myself and my wife are writing to ask for some guidance on a matter that’s been bothering us. We have a legal right of way over a neighbouring field that gives us access to the public road.

news.title: ‘I’ll miss playing until the day I die’ – Johnny Sexton sticking to kicking for now as he adapts to Lions set-up
news.summary: There was an icy wind cutting across the Gio Stadium pitch as Johnny Sexton worked with Blair Kinghorn, Finn Russell, Fin Smith, Marcus Smith and Owen Farrell after the Lions had finished their training session.

news.title: ‘We can spot the use of AI a mile off’ – recruiters share some of the reasons your CV isn’t making the cut
news.summary: If you stare at your own CV for long enough, you start to lose track of what you even wanted to get across. Maybe that’s why it’s so easy to fall into the trap of tried-and-tested phrasing and formatting.

news.title: ‘I don’t feel 100 at all, my mind is as sharp as a pin’ – Woman celebrates turning 100 and shares secret to long life
news.summary: A woman who celebrated her 100th birthday in Bangor, Co Down, last week happily admits to being a big fan of Love Island — and to owning a pair of shoes for every year of her long and music-filled life.

news.title: Lucinda O’Sullivan’s restaurant review: You’ll be flying high after tasting the culinary excellence at Kevin O’Donnell’s Comet
news.summary: When chefs of note decide to go it alone and establish their own restaurant, it can feel a bit like Le Mans. There's anticipation in the air, with years of training to arrive at this moment.
